title: Wayne Shorter
summary: Wayne Shorter (born August 25, 1933) is an American jazz saxophonist and composer.[1] Shorter came to wide prominence in the late 1950s as a member of, and eventually primary composer for, Art Blakey's Jazz Messengers. In the 1960s, he went on to join Miles Davis's Second Great Quintet, and from there he co-founded the jazz fusion band Weather Report. He has recorded over 20 albums as a bandleader.
